boardgame.name: Escape Game: Die verlassene Schule
boardgame.description:
In this escape game for kids, you visit your school while it is closed. After a few seconds it gets really scary: the entrance gate suddenly closes and you can't get out!

Just like in a real Escape Room, you are locked in a mysterious place. Now you have to work together to find the exit by solving logic puzzles and mathematical problems and looking very carefully. Use the objects you find during your adventure, pay attention to even the smallest details and don't be in a hurry: if you manage to solve all the puzzles correctly, you can escape and be safe.

boardgame.name: Guía de inicio Nahui Ollin
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Nahui Ollin es un juego de rol sobre la exploración, conquista y colonización de América en el que la historia se mezcla con la leyenda y el mito con la realidad. Esta guía de inicio contiene todo lo necesario para comenzar a vivir aventuras en la América de Nahui Ollin, conocer a sus pobladores, incluso hacer frente a algunas de sus criaturas más legendarias. Con ella podréis crear vuestros propios personajes, aprender las reglas básicas, de combate y de magia e incluso ponerlos a prueba en la aventura introductoria «Palabras de Paz, Vientos de Guerra».

Explora el nuevo juego de Ricard Ibáñez, autor del aclamado juego de rol demoníaco medieval Aquelarre, y descubre lo que está por venir en el manual completo de Nahui Ollin.

boardgame.name: Mystery Poster #1: A Greek Life
boardgame.description:
Mystery Poster #1: A Greek Life is the first of a series of narrative puzzle games on a poster.
Unfold the story of your ancestor on a large (A1 format) collage.

The game consists of 13 puzzles, each composed of various fragments that the players need to connect together by using observation and deduction skills.

boardgame.name: Nahui Ollin
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Cuando terminó de llover, los dioses se reunieron en Teotihuacán. Había que crear un nuevo sol, y este había de durar para siempre. Pero ya no le quedaba fuerza a ningún dios para crearlo, así que se sacrificaron todos, juntaron sus fuerzas y renunciaron a manifestarse en el mundo para que el quinto sol, Nahui Ollin, naciera. Era un sol que había de durar mientras los viejos rituales de los dioses se mantuvieran, pues, si no se hacía, se rompería la alianza, se destruiría el pacto entre dioses y hombres y entonces las pesadillas vendrían desde más allá de los sueños para devorar a la humanidad del quinto sol. Y ya no quedaría ningún dios para crear un sol nuevo.

Profecía del Códice Mixteca de Antonio Valeriano

Nahui Ollin es un juego de rol sobre la exploración, conquista y colonización de América en el que la historia se mezcla con la leyenda y el mito con la realidad. En él viviréis aventuras en un mundo sumido en un choque de culturas, un mundo de conquistadores recién llegados que imponen su religión, revueltas de indígenas que buscan recuperar su orgullo y su libertad, dioses antaño omnipotentes que ya no pueden proteger a su gente, enemigos de los hombres que fueron desterrados tiempo atrás y magia como nunca se ha visto en el Viejo Mundo.

Nahui Ollin es el nuevo juego de Ricard Ibáñez, autor de Aquelarre, el aclamado juego de rol demoníaco medieval. En sus páginas encontrarás:


Reglas para la creación de personajes de cualquier origen y profesión.
Un sistema de juego percentil diseñado para cubrir cualquier situación de conflicto entre los protagonistas y los peligros del Nuevo Mundo.
Tres clases de magia: maleficios, rituales y magia de sangre, con sus correspondientes listas de hechizos.
Un amplio bestiario que abarca desde animales corrientes hasta criaturas místicas y espíritus protectores.
Una extensa ambientación con personajes históricos, una cronología de 1492 a 1580 y descripciones de las gentes y territorios que forman el mundo de Nahui Ollin, incluyendo lugares legendarios, perdidos y olvidados.
Cuatro aventuras listas para jugar y numerosas ideas de aventuras.

boardgame.name: Nahui Ollin: Pantalla del Tlatoani
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

La pantalla de Nahui Ollin: Pantalla del Tlatoani es una ayuda indispensable para tus partidas del juego de exploración de los peligros del Nuevo Mundo.

Sus características son:


Tres paneles a todo color con una ilustración exclusiva de Adrián Virlan con una medida total de 835 x 218 mm.
Tres paneles con las tablas más relevantes y resúmenes de reglas para facilitar tu trabajo como director en medio de la partida.


Además, disfruta de la edición digital en formato PDF, diseñada para ser vista en tablets o para imprimir la página que necesitas tener en la mesa. Disfruta de este complemento de juego en tus partidas de la manera que prefieras.

boardgame.name: Mini Crimes: il matto affogato
Mini Crimes: The Drowned King
boardgame.description:
In your hands you have an investigative case that you can play alone or with friends. It takes little space, a bit of time and a lot of ingenuity.
But remember, one case leads to another!

Six chapters for six compact boxes to carry with you in every situation: the box itself contains the rules of the game, and along with the deck of cards contained in it, it will be enough to get all the clues necessary to the resolution!

Mini Crimes is a cooperative investigative game in which you'll put your observation and deduction skills to the test to solve a mysterious case. You'll analyse a crime scene and up to 10 clues.
Choose carefully and solve the mystery!

In 'Mini Crimes: Il Matto Affogato' ("Mini Crimes: The Drowned King"), the famous Italian chess champion Marco Maccarone is found dead in the bathtub of his hotel room in Berlin. It's the eve of his match at the world chess championship. Was it an accident or...?

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Mini Crimes: The End of the Games
boardgame.description:
In your hands you have an investigative case that you can play alone or with friends. It takes little space, a bit of time and a lot of ingenuity.
But remember, one case leads to another!

Six chapters for six compact boxes to carry with you in every situation: the box itself contains the rules of the game, and along with the deck of cards contained in it, it will be enough to get all the clues necessary to the resolution!

MiniCrimes is a cooperative investigative game in which you'll put your observation and deduction skills to the test to solve a mysterious case. You'll analyze a crime scene and up to 10 clues.
Choose carefully and solve the mystery!

'In Mini Crimes: La fine dei giochi' ("Mini Crimes: The end of the games"), a fan of comics, toys and science fiction is found dead in his house, hit on the head by a vase.
How can a simple person loved by all make such a terrible end?

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Fire & Stone
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
This zine contains step-by-step instructions get your OSR characters ready for perilous adventures in the Stone Age that could have been. Inspired by real-life prehistory and animistic beliefs, it hints at strange creatures, awful caves, and spirits that beckon from just beyond the unexplored horizon.

While it is designed specifically for compatibility with Knave by Ben Milton, it can easily be slotted into any ‘Old-School’ RPG.

boardgame.name: 252-NEWS (Issue 3 - Feb 1989)
boardgame.description:
The club explains its name and tells about travels in Scotland (it's related).
PBM reviews (Feudalherren, Celestrek) and "Phalanx" rules excerpt from the game Arlaan
an article on Car Wars
con reports
news
a guild of healers
healing tables for Space Master


and various other articles

boardgame.name: MASHED Camp Cards
boardgame.description:
MASHED is a tabletop roleplaying game that uses Powered by the Apocalypse rules to explore the lives of Korean War medics and affiliated personnel in a Mobile Army Surgical Hospital (MASH).

This deck contains 70 cards displaying various camp tents, structures, and landscape features. As you create your camp through the fiction of a MASHED RPG session, place the appropriate location card on the table roughly where it appears in relation to other locations in and around the camp. Don’t be overly concerned about distance and the space between cards—just treat them as a quick visual reference. It’s an easy and fast alternative to hand-drawing a map! This deck is optional and not required to play the MASHED RPG.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: MASHED: A Korean War MASH RPG

boardgame.name: MASHED Casualty and Wound Cards
boardgame.description:
MASHED is a tabletop roleplaying game that uses Powered by the Apocalypse rules to explore the lives of Korean War medics and affiliated personnel in a Mobile Army Surgical Hospital (MASH).

This product contains 120 cards including the Casualty Cards deck, the Wound Cards deck, and Instructions card. Use these decks in combination to rapidly generate random patients for your MASH operating room surgeons or battlefield medics. These cards are optional and are not required to play the MASHED RPG.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: MASHED: A Korean War MASH RPG

boardgame.name: MASHED Event Cards
boardgame.description:
MASHED is a tabletop roleplaying game that uses Powered by the Apocalypse rules to explore the lives of Korean War medics and affiliated personnel in a Mobile Army Surgical Hospital (MASH).

As you play through the fiction of a MASHED RPG session, you may at times want to throw in a random element. When you feel like adding something unexpected, shuffle this 52-card deck and draw a card. Each card contains something that you notice and asks “What do you do?” after you spot it. This card deck is optional and not required to play the MASHED RPG.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: MASHED: A Korean War MASH RPG

boardgame.name: Asset Deck
boardgame.description:
Sometimes characters are inspired even when their players aren’t

Sometimes things just come together. Sometimes you just happen to have exactly the ideal tool, or the perfect insight.

And sometimes it’s great to give the players just a touch of inspiration and additional narrative control. And a little extra reward for a particularly challenging encounter or adventure.

The 100-card Asset Deck brings all these factors together, adding a new dimension of play to any Numenera, The Strange, or Cypher System game. At the conclusion of an adventure, at the end of an important encounter—or anytime you want to reward excellent play—give your players a card from the Asset Deck. You can draw one at random or pick one that seems just right. The card provides an asset the player can hang onto and play whenever they wish.

These cards put more narrative power in the hands of the players, allow characters to be a bit inspired even when their players might not be, and enhance the fun of the whole group!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Promethean: the Created Condition Cards
boardgame.description:
You are a pilgrim now, one of the Created. You rose to life from dead flesh or inert matter, under the ministrations of one of your own, or a mad scientist, or perhaps just the power of the Divine Fire. You wander the world, sometimes alone, sometimes in the blessed company of your own kind, driven by memories of events and facts you never knew, all in the service of one Great Work…

…to be human.

Part of the Promethean: the Created 2nd Edition rules, Conditions add an additional layer of consequence and reward to certain actions in the Chronicles of Darkness. Various things within the course of a game can cause Conditions. These include exceptional successes, supernatural abilities, and really any situation where the Storyteller thinks they can be used to heighten the drama of a game.

These Promethean: the Created 2nd Edition Condition Cards are a handy way to keep track of and incorporate Conditions into your Chronicle with each of the 36 cards featuring a single Condition.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: You Will Feel a Slight Pinch
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You Will Feel a Slight Pinch introduces a new and sinister villain to the world of Demon Lord, one who poses incredible danger to the good people of Gateway and, perhaps, the lands beyond: Doctor Touch. In this supplement, you’ll find details on the character’s history, how he fits into the setting, and a survey of his ambitions, all to spark ideas for building adventures centered on him. Doctor Touch can give life, but he’d rather take it. No appointments necessary, the Doctor will see you now.

boardgame.name: Ascoleth: The Last Great City
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A system neutral zine toolkit for weird science-fantasy city roleplaying.

So, What Is It?
In collaboration with Rabid Halfling Press this is their most excellent weird science-fantasy system neutral city toolkit zine... Part 1 of the Finisterre Trilogy, Ascoleth: The Last Great City.

“Ascoleth - the largest city at the end of times.
A place for everyone, for good or bad.
A terrifying and marvellous place where science and magic are one and the same.
A place where you can find, buy, pray to and/or consume anything or anyone.
Please, enjoy your stay.”

This book is a toolkit for the GM to easily run a weird metropolitan city for science-fantasy games. It is system agnostic to easily fit within your rule-set of choice.
This is a low prep kit that a GM can use to pull ideas from during a game session. With the help of short punchy tables intended to be improvisational prompts, they invite immediate and unique adventure. The city is also a fully-playable setting on its own. With the help of district tables, struggling GMs can easily create strange city blocks full of adventure seeds.
There are aspects of this book that are intentionally incomplete. This is so you make Ascoleth wholly your own and to give the outcome of every play-through a chance to grow organically. Of course, you can always use this book to spruce up your own campaign setting by rolling on the tables within and/or plucking out the bits you like most.
The idea to write a book of prompts came from the fact that your humble zine writers are both parents with full time occupations. We struggle with having the time or energy to prep for games that necessitate reading huge blocks of text. There are so many great, intricately-designed games and setting books, but they often require more time and effort than we are able to give them at this stage in our lives. So, we created a player-driven book where the GM—with a minimal amount of preparation—can play in a setting that rewards exploration and imaginative co-creation at the table.

boardgame.name: Moonsea: A Guide to the Zethlentyn Protectorate
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Sights Below the Moonsea, a brief guide to the Zethlentyn Protectorate and its history, inhabitants, and traditions. This guide is far from exhaustive. It is a living document that receives updates as more areas within the Protectorate are explored and developed. The guide serves two purposes.

Firstly, it provides background that could be useful for dungeon masters who are running the Swords and Spies Below the Moonsea series of adventures as well as the future adventures set in the area. The guide is not required to run the adventures, but can provide extra information for games with curious players who wish to delve deeper into the background.

Secondly, the guide serves as a common base for anyone wishing to set adventures in the area. A hidden chapter (available by request) has additional information on some of the long term plans for the setting and some of the hidden machinations happening behind the scenes.

boardgame.name: Priestess of a Legally Distinct Spider Goddess
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A Priestess Of A Legally Distinct Spider Goddess is a support and debuff focused class whose main action on any given round is going to be to whip someone and they’ll either say “ow!” or “hooray!” depending on whether they were the Priestesses’ enemy or ally, respectively. She starts with an unlimited ability to hand out buffs loosely equivalent to the Cleric’s Bless with the caveat that she has to actually hit her teammates with her whip for 1d4+- DEX slashing damage every time she does, and the buff wears off so quickly that she has to do it every turn.

boardgame.name: Assault on the Führer Train
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Climb Aboard Hitler’s Steel Behemoth!

It is November 1944 and as winter descends, the Allied advance rumbles to a halt on the borders of Fortress Germany. The US Army and German defenders settle down in a stalemate as they watch each warily across the Siegfried Line.

In just a few short days Operation Watch on the Rhine, or the Battle of the Bulge as history will come to know it, will be launched, but other forces are also at play in the snowy Ardennes.

Credible intelligence reaches a local resistance cell that an armoured train which contains the Führer himself, is heading toward a secret Black Sun and Nachtwölfe facility deep in the heart of the forest.

With time pressing, resistance leader Marta Archambaud seizes her chance and decides to gamble on a covert raid, hoping to clamber aboard, sweep through the train, and cut off the head of the snake by assassinating Hitler himself.

It is a dangerous, possibly even foolhardy mission and the odds are stacked against her, but Marta and four brave colleagues are prepared to risk all, for if they succeed, they can bring the war to a premature conclusion saving millions of lives.

But is this a genuine chance to kill the Führer or a carefully baited trap designed to draw the resistance out and lure them to their deaths? Find out in this thrilling mission!

Features

A 50-page standalone mission for Resistance agents
Can be run as a prequel to the main Forest of Fear campaign, or can be played as an exciting standalone adventure in its own right
Features a breathtaking cover and full colour artwork, plus blueprints and maps of the steel behemoth
Contains five pre-generated resistance heroes ready to launch the assault, with print-at-home handouts and maps to enhance your tabletop play

boardgame.name: The Tomb of Kor
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The Tomb of Kor is a short dungeon packed with traps, secrets, and treasure. Kor’s Tomb is intended to be a short adventure for low- to medium-level characters and is especially good at providing some opportunities for extra loot and creative problem-solving. This adventure is suitable for any D20 type system and can be easily translated to a specific system if you need to.

The Tomb of Kor is a legendary tomb of the great king Kor, never before opened, until now. Your players will venture into this legendary tomb that robbers have recently opened, inside they will find secret doors, traps, and treasure; and may awaken mummies who have been sealed away for centuries.

This adventure includes thirteen unique magical items, complete enemy rules, plot hook suggestions, a clear map, and concise room mechanics. Everything you need to run one or two nights of gameplay in only 17 pages!

This is the first adventure in Sword and Tower Games' "Pocket Sized Adventurers" series. These are A5 sized books, short in page count, but jam-packed with content. Perfect for one or two nights of gameplay, and designed to be run with minimal prep. Just grab a book, some dice, and go! These books are designed for any D20 dice system, but typically only a D20 and a D6 are needed to run the adventure.

boardgame.name: Strange Ways: Six Classes and Alternate Magical Systems for Any OSR Adventure Game
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strange Ways offers you six playable classes for OSR adventure games (such as OSRIC or Swords & Wizardry,) each with unique subsystems for using powers far weirder than the average spells:

Wield poisons, explosives, and drugs as an Alchemist.

Burn away your foes as the Incinerator.

Manipulate the powers of the mind with the Psion,

Bend reality itself to your imagination as a Sorcerer.

Become twisted by the powers of the Great Old Ones as one of the Voidwarped.

Or make terrible pacts with alien spirits as a Witch.

boardgame.name: The Queen of Decay
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Queen of Decay is an adventure module built for Low Fantasy Gaming. It introduces the upcoming World of Wierth setting from Stephen Smith. It is compatible with both the baseline LFG rule set and the upcoming World of Weirthrules.

The Adventure is intended for characters of levels 3 to 5.

The PCs are tasked with exploring a deadly swamp full of hallucinogenic plants to rescue a priestess from Vorala, a desperate witch who forces the priestess to use her unique talents to read the dreams of long-dead cultists in hopes of finding the secret to true Resurrection.

PCs must face intelligent mutant animals, man eating fungus, mad AIs from before the cataclysm that reshaped Weirth, immortal cultists, and Vorala's hoard of Undead minions. Hopefully before their minds, or the priestess', are shattered by the mind-bending properties of Malpheg swamp or the insane dreams of the long dead cult of Yig-Knoss.

boardgame.name: Tower of the Moon (TFT)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The wolf-cult of the moon-goddess Lukariel Sherikira held sway in the Barony; with the Tower of the Moon their high holy temple. After a night of screams and horror, the tower – and its rumored riches – stood abandoned. The locals all know the way to the Tower. They also know to avoid it. Rumors of trouble coming from the tower spread through the local village of Waldrand. An important person is missing, her last known destination, the Tower of the Moon. Can you find her? Is it already too late? Who will unlock the secrets of the lost cult of Lukariel Sherikira? The adventure includes

Suggestions on where to place Waldrand and the Tower so it blends into your campaign
Just enough background to inform the scenario and give the characters some hooks
Rumors both true and wildly exaggerated
Detailed maps of the tower, both in isometric view and top-down melee-scale hex size
A room-by room adventure


This is a classic side-quest horror adventure; it makes a fantastic diversion as part of any longer journey, or a one-shot. And Halloween is coming . . .

The Tower of the Moon adventure was first published by Night Owl Games for Swords and Wizardry, but was substantially rewritten to be compatible with The Fantasy Trip.

boardgame.name: Arcadia (Issue 16 - May 2022)
boardgame.description:
Arcadia
Issue 16
May 2022

boardgame.name: Stadt Land VOLLPFOSTEN: Das Kartenspiel
boardgame.description: In a variation of the classic Scattergories, players draw 8 letter cards. A question category is read aloud and the players must find a matching term as quickly as possible that begins with a letter for which they have the matching hand card. The fastest player gets to discard their hand card. Besides these regular rounds, there are 7 categories of action cards. The first player to discard all cards wins the round and the first player to win three rounds wins the game.

boardgame.name: Aeon's End: Past and Future
boardgame.description:
Two interconnected storylines take players back in time, and hundreds of years into the future, in an exciting new expansion for Aeon's End!

Aeon's End: Past and Future includes two full expeditions: The Past Campaign and the Future Campaign. These narratives can be played in either order - Future first, or Past first.

The expansion includes:

- 10 New Mages
- 6 New Nemeses
- 18 New Market Cards
- 15 Stop Decks
- 10 Envelopes
- 2 Narrative Booklets
- 18 Card Dividers for Storage
- All Tokens Required to Play

Please Note: For expedition play, a copy of either Aeon's End: New Age or Aeon's End: Outcasts is required.

boardgame.name: Arcadia (Issue 11 - Dec 2021)
boardgame.description:
Arcadia
Issue 11
December 2021

boardgame.name: Arcadia (Issue 12 - Jan 2022)
boardgame.description:
Arcadia
Issue 12
January 2022
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: So Your Best Friend is a Monster

boardgame.name: Arcadia (Issue 15 - Apr 2022)
boardgame.description:
Arcadia
Issue 15
April 2022
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: What They Know May Hurt You

boardgame.name: Pear Shaped
boardgame.description:
What do you do when the world’s gone pear shaped? How about play our fast and frantic game, ‘Pear Shaped’ for a rocking good time!

Round up your nearest & dearest, pull back the rocking pear timer and let the game begin.

The rules? You can match by object, colour or number… but if there's an exact match, all bets are off and it’s a race against your fellow gamers to grab the rocking pear!

Objective: To get rid of all of your cards by playing matching cards into the play pile. The first player to get rid of all the cards in their hand and draw pile is the winner.

Family, friends, coworkers - this is the pear-fect game for everyone!

Oh, and don’t forget to “do the Shakes Pear” when the timer stops or when you win! (aka rock side to side in triumph).... We’re so going to get some music for the Shakes Pear! - Got any ideas?

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Blacksad: Dados
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

El set de dados oficiales de Blacksad: Juego de Rol te ofrece cinco dados de acción (negros), cinco dados complementarios (blancos) y dos dados de tensión (rojos). Todos ellos cuentan con el rostro del detective John Blacksad para reflejar los éxitos y, en el caso de los dados complementarios y de tensión, agujeros de bala para reflejar los fallos. Con la ayuda de estos doce dados personalizados te será todavía más fácil interpretar los resultados de las acciones de tus personajes.

Este pack incluye:


5 dados negros de acción.
5 dados blancos complementarios.
2 dados rojos de tensión.

boardgame.name: Fortnite: Save The World
boardgame.description: Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fortnite%3A_Save_the_World Fortnite: Save the World]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Cuentos de las Nuevas Tierras
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Nuestros antepasados vinieron del norte siguiendo la Estrella Roja. Diez generaciones pasaron recorriendo el desierto de hielo hasta que encontraron a los gigantes. La guerra duró cien años y, al final, sus castillos fueron destruidos y los hombres continuaron su marcha. El hielo se iba retirando y los días se hacían más y más largos hasta que encontraron el Océano Tormentoso.

Doscientos años después cruzamos el Paso Estrecho, antes de que el océano lo reclamase para siempre. Así llegamos a estas tierras. Cuando la Estrella Roja desapareció bajo el horizonte para no volver fue la señal de que habíamos llegado a nuestro destino. Enterramos los restos de nuestros antepasados y cada clan se separó del resto y se asentó en las Nuevas Tierras. A partir de ahí, cada uno cuenta una historia distinta. Es nuestra tarea rememorar las leyendas de nuestros ancestros para hacer frente al mundo que nos rodea.

Necesitas una copia de Fate Acelerado para poder jugar a Cuentos de las Nuevas Tierras. Este Mundo Fate contiene:


Un mundo donde vivir Aventuras con mayúsculas: grandes paisajes, peligros mortales, luchas heroicas y magia poderosa.
Reglas para la creación de héroes irathy, sus clanes y sus antepasados.
Un sistema para narrar las leyendas de los ancestros y usarlas para afectar el presente.
La Hondonada Cobriza y sus habitantes como punto de partida para tus aventuras.

boardgame.name: Beaver Brawl
boardgame.description:
A beaver card game where players compete against each other simultaneously and try to cut down the opponent's trees!

Beaver Brawl requires players to develop alliances in the early game and play in a smart way to avoid the infamous Beaverona card(which would eliminate the player from the game).

After the Beaverona is drawn, the game becomes a pure strategy card game where attack and defend actions need to be performed at the right time not to overexpose the player.

Every player starts with 4 cards in their hands and plays a combination of them every turn to defend their tree or attack someone's tree.

They draw from the deck the same amount of cards they played.

When a player draws the Beaverona or loses all its trees, it is eliminated from the game.

The last player standing wins!

boardgame.name: Shortcuts to Adventure #1: Shrine of the Slime God
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shortcuts to Adventure is a new series of mini-adventures designed to be fit into any dungeon, sewer, or ruined city. Each consists of five to 10 rooms, no more, and has an adventure theme.

The first Shortcut to Adventure is the Shrine of the Slime-God. Here horrible Chaotic and Evil priests and cultists come to worship the Demon-Prince of Slime. Here they store their treasures when they return home and hide in obscurity among their Lawful, Goodly neighbors… but they do not leave these treasures unguarded!

Designed for a party of 4th to 6th level adventurers, this adventure can easily be adjusted to higher or lower levels by altering the mix and number of monsters present.

boardgame.name: Shortcuts to Adventure #2: The Lost Gnome Mine
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shortcuts to Adventure is a new series of mini-adventures designed to be fit into any dungeon, sewer, or ruined city. Each consists of five to 10 rooms, no more, and has an adventure theme.

The second Shortcut to Adventure module is The Lost Gnome Mine. Here long ago a clan of gnomes discovered a huge and beautiful black diamond. So magnificent was it, they began to worship it. Then, strange and terrible things happened, and the gnomes disappeared. But it is said that the huge black diamond, worth a king’s ransom, remains to be found…

Designed for a party of 1st to 3rd level adventurers, this adventure can easily be adjusted to higher levels by altering the mix and number of monsters present.

boardgame.name: Fairies Fair and Foul Volume 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fairies Fair and Foul series transforms the list of fairies from Michael Denham’s famous tracts into a series of creatures fit for encounters in Labyrinth Lord and other Old School RPGs.

The fairies included herein are not necessarily based on myths and legends, taking merely inspiration from the name and possibly inspiration from myths and legends. Some are created from whole cloth, much as many of the names of fairies in the Denham Tracts most likely were.

Rest assured, they will challenge your players with new and interesting encounters!

This first volume includes seven new types of fairies:

The Alholde Fairy – A household fairy who only the rich and powerful can afford.

The Fairy Apparition – A creature literally born of fairy nightmares!

The Banshee Fairy – Wicked fairies all too… keen… on avenging themselves on all other life!

The Barguest Fairy – A greedy beast of a fairy who toys with his enemies like a cat does a mouse…

The Black Dog Fairy – Guardians at the crossroads between the Fairy and Mortal worlds.

The Black Bug Fairy – Mortals should be careful when they wish upon a star, as they never know who might be listening…

The Bloody Bones Fairy – These traitorous fairies have lost their heads… but a little setback like that would never stop them. Just don’t lose your head when you encounter them…

boardgame.name: Failed Thievish Doings
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth and flavour to the failed thievish doings in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Vampire's Crypt
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth and flavour to the vampire crypts in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Failed Thievish Doings
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the failed thievish doings in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Amazons Vs Valkyries: Sorceress Origins
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This file covers the four most common sorceress origins in the Amazons vs Valkyries adventure setting, including:

Arcane Ancestor: One of your ancestors was a powerful mage. Her arcane experiments permanently changed her and her descendants.
Divine Ancestor: You are distantly related to a deity. A tiny fragment of godly power shines within you.
Elemental Ancestor: There is an elemental in your ancestry, perhaps a nereid or a genie.
Fey Ancestor: You have a fairy in your family history, perhaps a dryad, sprite, or brownie.

If you're playing an Amazons vs Valkyries campaign, these origins are essential. If you're playing another Norse or Greek themed setting, definitely check this out! And if your campaign doesn't have sorceresses who derive their power from ancient wizards, deities, elemental powers, and fey, it should!

boardgame.name: Monk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monk Class for use with Old School Essentials and other B/X based OSR game systems

boardgame.name: microCrime
boardgame.description:
microCrime is a Roll-and-Write investigation game for 1+ people. You are the detective. And you need to solve the case. It features intriguing game mechanics, ever changing scenarios, a detailed Rulebook and tables. Plus, it's endless and ever changing!

The game starts soon after the Chief Inspector ends writing the premises of the case on the Case File by rolling dice several times and writing down the results took from the rulebook's tables.

At this point, all the players try to solve the case, building up a story which should include and bring to light all the elements, especially the missing ones, of the crimes scene, getting to a final solution, in order to close the case.

Detectives discuss their ideas and perceptions of the crime scene in its whole and try to figure out a possible solution, finding a meeting point that could explain the murder.

Investigation can vary in duration, based on the ability of the detectives to deal with the fundamental six questions every detective is asked to answer to close any case: How? What? When? Where? Why? Who?

While the investigation goes on, detectives should try to enrich their reconstruction of the case with more and more detailed elements.

Discussion and interpretation are fundamental, during this part of the game. Only with discussion, deduction and compromises they'll be able to meet a point where everyone is satisfied with the story.

When all involved players are pleased with the reconstruction they inform the Chief Inspector which writes down the story, closing the investigation, solving the case and, ultimately, ending the game.

It goes without saying that if players can‘t build up a story encasing all the elements of the crimes scene and get to a final solution, they can agree to archive the case. In this case players might want to try and solve the case another time, considering it a cold case.

To play this game no investigation knowledge or improvisation skills are necessary. Players debate the case, evidences and dice results by combining all the elements to create the most convincing and entertaining solution for the case.

Also, the crime scene is the main attraction of microCrime and the game gives you the opportunity to immerse yourself in it. After players select an area to play in (it might be the bedroom, the kitchen or any other space they want, like the courtyard, the garage or anything else) they can consider that space like a real crime scene by exploring it and simply by walking and looking around.

Moving through the crime scene and looking carefully at its peculiarities could prove to be really useful and interesting.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: 茶の間のきまぐれねこさま (As the Cat Says)
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
A family-friendly party card game with simple rules & reversal elements.

Here we are is cat café which is topic of the street. You are the staff of this shop. Cats are relaxing around. When the time goes by slowly, one of the staff whispered, "Who is most liked by them?"

You do everything to the cats. Of course, to be the most favorite of the cats in this shop.


Each round, the staff of this cat café must try and guess what the cat is going to want from them. You'll know which of the four cat decks is going to be drawn from next, and if you've been paying attention, you should have an idea of the cards left in that deck. You'll play one of your four prediction cards, and either gain or lose the cat's favorability.

But be careful which prediction card you play, because you only have one of each! You can play your 'Leave Me Alone' card to avoid losing favorability, and to return all your cards back to your hand.

You also have a 'Full Power' card you can use when you're really confident in your prediction. If you guessed right, you can get a favorability bonus - either +5, +15, x3, or even x4 - depending on where you are on the scoring track. But the 'Full Power' card has to rest for a while before it can be used again, so choose wisely!

The staff member who the cats like best wins!

boardgame.name: The Terminator RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You play resistance fighters struggling against the machine onslaught of Skynet in an alternative and post-apocalyptic version of today—the once "far future" of the 2020s. You can take the role of rebel time travellers sent back to various points in time to stop Skynet from altering history. You can even play natives of any historical time period, targeted by Terminators and trying to stay alive as a future hell is unleashed around you.

boardgame.name: The Terminator RPG: Campaign Book
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the Dark Future, the Resistance stands on the cusp of victory. Skynet’s defense grid is vulnerable and John Connor has a plan to smash it and win the war. But the insidious AI has decided to play dirty, experimenting with time displacement technology in an attempt to shear the Resistance from its roots and murder its leader before he’s even born. The mission to save John Connor has already begun, but it isn’t the only battle that must play out in the past. The Resistance may start with Connor, but it ends with you.

boardgame.name: The Terminator RPG: Director's Pack
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Three mini-campaigns, designed to give the Director a loose framework from which 1-3 Mission sessions may be constructed, are narratively linked to one another.

boardgame.name: StokerVerse Quickstart
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dracula is dead, of that we should be certain. The brave Texan, Quincey Morris, pierced his chest with a bowie knife. Morris paid with his life when he severed the great vampire’s ties to the mortal world. I can see by the puzzled look on your face that you may not be familiar with the full facts of this story. You may have read of a mysterious Romanian Count’s disappearance in the Strand or perhaps heard of the case of the Demeter? Pour yourself a stiff drink and I shall regale you with a tale which is as cold and dark as the crypt of Lord Blackwood in Highgate Cemetery.

boardgame.name: The Magical World of Disney Trivia
boardgame.description:
2,000 questions spanning Disney's history from Steamboat Willie to 2022!.

Special pictures cards, and 3d sculpts, and deluxe character pawns make this a trivia game for the whole family to enjoy.

To Play:
Players take turns spinning the spinner and moving their detailed miniature. If they land on a colored square they try to answer the question. If they get it correct they get a colored paint splash (If they dont have that color yet) and get to roll again. Questions are available in Adult and Kids skill levels.
If a player lands on a swirly portal, they are able to transport to any of the locations they choose. Each color the player needs to collect has a special location to teleport to and try to earn the color.

First one to collect all the needed colors and make it to the end of the board, wins.

boardgame.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Badar Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
Beta Rules - 2 x Glossary Card, 1 x Gear Card, 1 Secret Fighting Art Card that were included with the Badar First Run Collector's Edition that was not part of the based game.

2 Glossary Cards for new living glossary: Cleave and Sealed.
New Gear: Toxicimitar with Sealed bonus and gain the Crescent Step Secret Fighting Art.
New Secret Fighting Art: Crescent Step with the new Cleave action.

The First Run Collector's Edition is enclosed in a hand-stamped kraft box, limited to 500 and includes:

Photoresin Badar
1 x Hard Plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round insert and base
Large Matte Art Print
Character Art Card
Beta Rules - 2 x Glossary Card, 1 x Gear Card, 1 Secret Fighting Art Card
First run collector's edition: Signed and numbered authenticity note
Deathgrey edition limited to 250: Deathgrey authenticity note

Badar drank from the chalice of black sand and embarked on his quest to slay the moon. Hatred boils within his guts, the catalyst needed to vomit black glass steps and ascend the stairless tower where his foe awaits.

boardgame.name: Last Haiku
boardgame.description:
Then the dreams overtook me. I conversed with the thousand poets long dead, they who trod the roads weaving toward eternity and never returned. In the morning’s warm embrace, my limbs felt their old vigor and the undeniable desire to travel. To seize the horizon. To behold hidden wonders. To exhume the words that will give life to my LAST HAIKU.

Last Haiku is a one-player adventure card game with a dose of creative writing. You are the latest in a long line of poets feeling your age, and you know you are not long for this world. Yet you also feel the call of distant, uncanny, and wondrous places where you might seek the inspiration to write one last haiku to leave to the ages to inspire future generations of poets, who may themselves discover stranger, more distant places to spark the words of their own haiku.

This is a “Make-as-You-Play” game, which means that the game starts with a few index cards and a pen. Each game will add new cards, either maps of locations or haiku your poet composed. The rules provide all the guidance you need for creating new cards and selecting the game’s thematic elements, which makes every copy of Last Haiku an evolving, unique world. In addition, it means that each game inherits all components added or changed in the previous games. There is no limit to the places you can visit and the poetry you can compose.

Each turn of the game involves playing cards of the appropriate distance. If the card was created in a previous game, your poet travels deeper into the frontier. If you cannot play an existing card, you create a new site on a card and your poet is inspired to write a line of haiku, these lines recorded on a separate card. The game ends when you have written each of three lines forming your poet’s last haiku, and your score equals the total of the distances of the new sites visited. Each new site and your haiku then enter the deck permanently.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Old School & Cool (Vol. 3 - 2022)
boardgame.description:
Old School & Cool
Volume 3
2022

boardgame.name: Dungeon Vault Magazine (No. 22)
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Vault Magazine
Issue 22

boardgame.name: Old School Blue Map #15
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This PDF contains Old School Blue Map #15. The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Old School Blue Map #16
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This PDF contains Old School Blue Map #16. The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This PDF contains Old School Blue Map #17. The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Old School Blue Map #18

Publisher's blurb:

This PDF contains Old School Blue Map #18. The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Old School Blue Map #19
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This PDF contains Old School Blue Map #19. It is the upper level of a temple complex. Last week's map (Old School Blue Map #18) was the ground level. The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Last week's map (Old School Blue Map #19) was the initial upper level and the map before that was the ground level (Old School Blue Map #18). The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.description:

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)

boardgame.name: Shonen Punch
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Pick a card, any card!

Shonen Punch brings you the anything-goes world of anime and manga superheroes, in its own unique setting. Characters of wildly different power levels work together defending Ichiban City against supervillains, kaiju, and terrorist organizations bent on world domination! Inspired by works like One Punch Man, My Hero Academia, and Gatchaman, among others, Shonen Punch uses Simon Washbourne’s innovative Triumphant! system to deliver fast and fluid anime action with minimal math!

boardgame.name: The Gates of Delirium
boardgame.description:
A Live Action Disaster Movie
It's just another day in your hometown, Greenville USA, an isolated community surrounded by industrial pig farms. The only news is about some big new project at the local University, but that's no concern of yours as you grab a quick lunch...

Until, without warning, everything changes.

With no time to think or plan, you need to make it through the sudden tears in reality now ripping your world apart. How will you stop this?

Can it be stopped?

The Gates of Delirium is a standalone Scenario of Colliding Realities for A Grandiose Disaster, and requires that game to play.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Estación Terminal
boardgame.description:
El tren se detiene en una vieja estación. Varias figuras vacilantes descienden al andén. Desconocidos. Recelosos. Intercambian miradas nerviosas mientras dan un vistazo en derredor. Delante, la más absoluta oscuridad. Detrás, una vida repleta de aristas. ¿Fin de trayecto? Ni mucho menos. Las luces parpadean sobre el umbral que anuncia la única salida.

Dicen que la estación devora a los viajeros, que los convierte en sombras encerradas en cárceles construidas con sus remordimientos para siempre. Dicen que, entre sus muros, encierra laberintos plagados por monstruos inenarrables y que, en el centro de esa pesadilla, están las respuestas que buscas.

Bienvenido a Estación Terminal.

En este nuevo Mundo Fate, los jugadores encarnarán a unos viajeros recién llegados a la estación. Deberán escapar de ella antes de que las sombras, reflejos y doppelgänger que moran más allá del umbral devoren su voluntad. No hay salida aparente, pero los viajeros más resueltos pueden descubrir claves ocultas que podrían resultar de ayuda, apenas unas migajas de luz en mitad de la oscuridad. Pronto comprenderán que cualquier esperanza de huida pasa por vencer a sus propios fantasmas.

Estación Terminal ofrece al director de juego un singular sistema narrativo para ajustar la geografía emocional del escenario a los miedos y pesares de los protagonistas a partir de sus aspectos más oscuros. El resultado es una historia siempre distinta, inquietante y personalizada.

boardgame.name: DUOS: Sports & Fairy Tales
boardgame.description:
12 pictures, and 4 pairs to choose. Oh, this pair is obvious... or is it?
How will the other players think? Can you predict?

12 cards and 4 pairs to create. Make pairs like the first player to score points. 2 categories (Sports & Fairy Tales) of cards and over 100 pictures in each. Simple rules and dynamic gameplay, plus lots of conversations over the table after each round. DUOS is a game that will work both with players and the family.

boardgame.name: Mini Crimes: Questioni di Famiglia
boardgame.description:
In your hands you have an investigative case that you can play alone or with friends. It takes little space, a bit of time and a lot of ingenuity.
But remember, one case leads to another!

Six chapters for six compact boxes to carry with you in every situation: the box itself contains the rules of the game, and along with the deck of cards contained in it, it will be enough to get all the clues necessary to the resolution!

MiniCrimes is a cooperative investigative game in which you'll put your observation and deduction skills to the test to solve a mysterious case. You'll analyse a crime scene and up to 10 clues.
Choose carefully and solve the mystery!

In Mini Crimes: Questioni di Famiglia ("Mini Crimes: Family matters"), the elderly Mrs Bingley, widow of Lord Crawford, a wine-collecting banker and vintage car collector, is found dead in her study, slumped on her desk like she was sleeping. What's happened?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Glitch
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

En la mitad de la noche un cuerpo extraterrestre penetra en la atmósfera. Tras unos instantes se convierte en un bólido, estallando a pocos kilómetros por encima del centro de la ciudad. Su deslumbrante destello hace que, por un momento, el día se adelante al amanecer. Segundos después la onda expansiva golpea la realidad, los cristales de muchos edificios se rompen y las alarmas de los coches y locales empiezan a aullar. Afortunadamente hay pocos heridos. Es un evento extraordinario, pero no un desastre. Sin embargo, marcará el inicio de una extraña aventura.

Glitch es una aventura sobre bugs cósmicos y pesadillas virtuales para Cultos Innombrables.

boardgame.name: Habitación 311
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

El pequeño pueblo de Forestmouth ha sufrido fenómenos extraños desde la masacre del hotel Black Pines en 1926: periódicas infestaciones de lombrices, nacimientos de becerros deformes y esa extraña savia rosa, de olor inaudito. Solo unas pocas personas sospechan que algo pudo quedar encerrado en aquel hotel de montaña, y que su poder se agita ahora más que nunca, poniendo a prueba lo que sea que logra contenerlo. Cualquier persona sensata temería acercarse al Black Pines, pero unos pocos anhelan descubrir el secreto que esconden aquellos pasillos infestados de líquenes y malos recuerdos.

Habitación 311 es una aventura de tintes rurales y atmósfera enrarecida para Cultos Innombrables. Forma parte de la primera temporada de Códigos Pnakóticos, pero puede jugarse de forma totalmente independiente con cualquier culto dispuesto a descubrir nuevos secretos arcanos.

boardgame.name: iNous
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tras un exitoso crowdfunding , que recibió miles de apoyos y recaudó casi cinco millones de dólares, el emprendedor Edward Pretorious saltó a la fama por su revolucionario dispositivo llamado iNous. Sin embargo, tras montones de retrasos, quejas de los mecenas y amenazas de demandas colectivas, Edward Pretorius ha aparecido decapitado en las nuevas y flamantes oficinas de su compañía, solo unos pocos días después de anunciar que el iNous estaba prácticamente listo para entrar en producción.

iNous es una aventura sobre nuevas tecnologías y dimensiones alternativas para Cultos Innombrables. Forma parte de la primera temporada de Códigos Pnakóticos, pero puede jugarse de forma totalmente independiente con cualquier culto dispuesto a descubrir nuevos secretos arcanos.

boardgame.name: Local de Ensayo
boardgame.description:
It's your time, now you can become the author you've always wanted and set up the group you've always dreamed of for the next COAC (Cadiz's Carnival Contest). But be careful, the rest of the authors will have their mission, to annoy you and to lead a better group than yours.

This card driven game lets you get a band together to compete in Cadiz's (Spain) most prestigious contest.

This is a filler game for anyone who wants to dare to put together a group for the next COAC. You can play from 2 to 6 players and being 7 years old is enough to be able to join the game, which will last between 15 and 30 minutes.

Each turn the player plays a card from their hand of three. This could be a voice from the chorus, an instrument, or some improvement to these. Once you have four diferent voices and four instruments, you can call for the end game. At that point, players count their points and the winner is decided.

Player may, instead of playing card to add to their band, play them for their special effects, affecting other players or even calling for an early end of game and point count.

boardgame.name: La Lista
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Un personaje tan extraño como esquivo convoca en Londres a los personajes jugadores para proponerles una atípica colaboración. Les ofrece una notable recompensa a cambio de un favor que sin lugar a dudas estarán dispuestos a realizar, a no ser que prefieran arriesgarse a que el asunto se convierta en algo demasiado personal. La lista de tareas a realizar es corta, pero intensa, y el tiempo disponible, limitado. Será un desafío que pondrá a prueba los estómagos sensibles y las moralidades más férreas.

boardgame.name: Mini Crimes: Come il gatto col topo
boardgame.description:
In your hands you have an investigative case that you can play alone or with friends. It takes little space, a bit of time and a lot of ingenuity.
But remember, one case leads to another!

Six chapters for six compact boxes to carry with you in every situation: the box itself contains the rules of the game, and along with the deck of cards contained in it, it will be enough to get all the clues necessary to the resolution!

Mini Crimes is a cooperative investigative game in which you'll put your observation and deduction skills to the test to solve a mysterious case. You'll analyse a crime scene and up to 10 clues.
Choose carefully and solve the mystery!

In Mini Crimes: Come il gatto col topo ("Mini Crimes: Like cat and mouse"), Leonardo, animal lover, discovers an unusual... crime. On his return home his goldfish is lifeless on the floor.
His broken water bowl on the ground. The first suspects are obviously the dog and the cat!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Postnomicón Vol.1
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

En este primer compendio de aventuras para Cultos Innombrables, cinco reconocidos autores se dan la mano para apuntalar dos conceptos esenciales del universo del juego: la búsqueda de la inmortalidad y la destrucción de la propia humanidad. Bajo la atenta mirada de Nyarlathotep, los protagonistas de estas aventuras se enfrentarán con una visión instrumental de los Mitos y su uso para la construcción de ciencia y tecnología al límite de lo concebible. ¿Sobrevivirán sus mentes y sus cuerpos a la abominable verdad y al corrupto poder que impregnan las autopistas y cloacas de la información? ¿O serán aniquilados, enterrados bajo capas y capas de conocimientos cada vez más crípticos, fractales y esquivos?

Postnomicón, volumen 1 te ofrece posesiones, pactos con fuerzas peores que el diablo, fiestas salvajes, drogas extraterrestres, rituales que necesitan ser completados y mucho más. Del frío parqué de las empresas bursátiles hasta las Tierras del Sueño y desde las claustrofóbicas y asépticas salas de un hospital psiquiátrico a los rincones más oscuros de la deep web, los personajes jugadores tendrán que medirse con grupos sin escrúpulos, maquinaciones inmortales, horrores extradimensionales y el peor monstruo posible: ellos mismos.

boardgame.name: Una Pérdida de Tiempo
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Meter las narices en lo oculto sin conocimiento de causa ni protección equivale a coger algo bonito del suelo: podrías pillar algo malo. Eso mismo debe estar pensando la pobre Polly O’Farrell mientras siente que algo le está robando el tiempo, literalmente, desde aquel fallido (en apariencia) ritual de invocación. Buscaba poder, pero solo consiguió convertirse en el huésped de algo ignoto. Desesperada, mientras su biorritmo se aletarga, O’Farrell acude al culto de los PJ para proponerles un trabajito: conseguir un objeto que podría ayudarla a entender qué le está pasando y, con suerte, ponerle remedio. Pero el tiempo de Polly se acaba.

El parásito que se alimenta de ella se hace más fuerte y amenaza con provocar una plaga de consecuencias fatales para los PJ, para Providence y puede que para toda la raza humana.

boardgame.name: Queensland
boardgame.description:
Create your own Australian farm in this tactical tile game. But watch out for toads! Queensland is besieged by a veritable toad infestation that is sweeping your farm too. The more toads you manage to remove through your ponds, the more points you earn. However, toads left on your farm will eat your crops. How much of your crop can you save from the toad infestation?

—description from the publisher (translated)
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

boardgame.name: The Dresden Files: Pantalla del DJ
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

La pantalla de The Dresden Files: Juego de rol es una ayuda indispensable para tus partidas en la ambientación de las novelas de Jim Butcher con el sistema Fate. Es un material exclusivo de la versión española con la aprobación del propio Jim Butcher.

Sus características son:


Tres paneles a todo color con una ilustración exclusiva de Javier Charro con una medida total de 835 x 218 mm.
Tres paneles con las tablas más relevantes y resúmenes de reglas para facilitar tu trabajo como director en medio de la partida.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: The Dresden Files: Pantalla del DJ

boardgame.name: The Long Way Home
boardgame.description:
A Live Action Disaster Movie

For the past ten years, Northern Lights Adventure Tours has offered modern adventurers an opportunity to take unique trips to the arctic. Many go on the tour to test their mettle against the cold conditions, some to experience the beauty of nature. Whatever the reason, Northern Lights guarantees coverage of participants needs with first class service and total attention to detail.

Once the plane goes down, though, all bets are off.

And nobody packed a lunch.

What are you willing to do to survive in the cold, barren mountains?

The Long Way Home is a standalone Scenario of Wilderness Survival and Cannibalism for A Grandiose Disaster, and requires that game to play.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Terror at Trinity
boardgame.description:
A Live Action Disaster Movie

Welcome to the Land of Enchantment! You have scored tickets to a special event to celebrate a major anniversary of the Trinity nuclear test of July 16, 1945. The select few on this behind-the-scenes tour of the underground Trinity facility have been warned to refrain from disturbing debris, and humorous "Don't Eat the Sand!" signs are everywhere.

But then something happens. Your guide to the underground labyrinth disappears. And you find some awfully strange things under the sand...

How will you survive the foces that have been unleashed?

Terror at Trinity is a standalone Scenario of Atomic Horror Survival for A Grandiose Disaster, and requires that game to play. Check it out here.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Hatch Fever
boardgame.description:
A Live Action Disaster Movie

They built the disease in a lab: a volatile infection that bypasses the healthy parts of the human body, seeking out and attacking cancerous cells to (hopefully) cure terminal patients. This was going to make medical history. They just needed a few test studies to make sure. You were promised a cure for your cancer, and it's been going weel so far. Today is the final injection, the last day of your isolation.

But nobody is here. You're locked in. And now you don't feel so well.

Will you find a cure before time runs out?

Hatch Fever is a standalone Scenario of Pandemic Horror for A Grandiose Disaster, and requires that game to play.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Dungeon of Doom
boardgame.description:
A Live Action Disaster Adventure Movie

You have heard the many legends of the Dungeon of Doom, the fabled treasure trove of traps and monsters. Many adventurers go in, but none have ever returned.

Your merry band of low-level adventurers have met in a tavern near the high wastes, across the barren plain, and just past the crags of terror that house the Dungeon of Doom. Your goal? To be the first to go in, grab the loot and get out with your skins intact.

You will then be able to retire in fame and glory!

No really, you'll totally survive!

The Dungeons of Doom is a (punny) standalone Scenario of Dungeon Delving Mayhem for A Grandiose Disaster, and requires that game to play.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Ultimate Board Game
boardgame.description:
The Ultimate Board Game is an exciting, competitive, fun game for 2 to 8 adults. The game is inspired by Ultimate and reproduces the dynamics of a tournament between two teams, consisting of a Match, a Party and a Final Match. To become The Ultimate Champion Team, collect the most victory points from the three stages of the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Metro Domino: London Edition
boardgame.description:
Metro Domino is a game where the mechanics are the same as Dominoes with the exception that players are attempting to link Stations/Depots together with an exact, pre-determined, number of Domino tiles.

Domino tiles are placed according to Domino rules, one end of a tile (at least) has to match the number on the last laid tile.

Points are scored by the value of the Stations. Luck and skill play a large part in the game play.

boardgame.name: Eastern Fleet: Gulf of Aden
boardgame.description:
In the spring of 1942, the Japanese contemplated invading the British-held island of Ceylon. From there they could strike many strategic targets around the Indian Ocean basin, none of these more vital than the southern outlet of the Red Sea, controlling the sea route to the Suez Canal and on to Europe. Far more important to the Axis cause than Midway Island, Japanese control of the chokepoint at the Strait of Bab-el-Mandeb would have broken British communications with India, Australia and New Zealand except for the lengthy and difficult route around the Cape of Good Hope, and made the entire campaign in North Africa superfluous.

Eastern Fleet: Gulf of Aden is a Campaign Study in the same format as Midway: Rising Sun 1940 or Coral Sea: Defending Australia, with 14 scenarios depicting a Japanese campaign in Gulf of Aden and Arabian Sea opposed by the British Eastern Fleet, heavily reinforced to defend this vital maritime crossroads. To play these scenarios, you’ll need Eastern Fleet, Horn of Africa, Midway Deluxe and Bismarck.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Second World War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

listing.notes: Publisher shipped this to me in a carboard mailer (no ziploc nor shink wrap). This item is a booklet only. It uses counters and maps from other games. See BGG description. Price includes media mail shipping to US only. Canadian buyers please provide address for shipping quote. US buyers who want expedited shipping, please message me. Price applies only to US addresses where media mail is $3 or less.

boardgame.name: Touché 2022
boardgame.description:
This is an award winning edition of the classic game.

Player pieces (own colour)are pyramid shaped and are placed on the board according to Playing Cards. Specific shapes have to be completed. These are then capped by Black pyramid tops and remain on the board once so capped.

—user summary

boardgame.name: 9-Card Dragonslayer
boardgame.description:
You are the great dragon slayer and have found the beast. It is cornered and now it is up to you to deliver the final blow.
Unfortunately for you the beast doesn't want to surrender and puts up a fight for its life.

Each turn you will roll your dice, assign damage to the dragon and prepare your defenses. Then the dragon will attack back, reacting with a determinable but variable sequence of actions.
The fight end when one of the opponents is slain.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Spawn Summoners
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

In ancient, prehistoric days, before the advent of humanity, these highland hills were ruled by a callous race of serpentine philosophers. They built temples to the chthonic nature goddess known to us as Shab-en-Haggálath, to harness her power. Through her they had access to the primal chaos at the centre of Creation, and could make her monstrous spawn obey their bidding. These reptiles are long gone now, but some of their works remain extant, though hidden and remote. And they are not abandoned.

In the lands of Arkas it is common for the people to reflect the wildness of nature in their features. Fauns and satyrs mingle with the commonest villagers, and every town has those with a claim to dryad kin. At night, the howls of the wolf-blooded are not unknown, but neither are the ways to keep them properly at bay. And yet there are those for whom the touch of nature is not enough. They wish also to refute their humanity and revel in the beastly nature of a chaos from beyond the stars.

In the ancient temples, hidden behind the forests in the mountains, they learned to summon the spawn of Shab-en-
Haggálath again. The weird energies of their magic burned the humanity from their bodies, just as the sight of churning chaos burned it out of their minds. Now they revel in the inhuman delights they can conjure up. They can see through the veil into worlds beyond our imagining. If only they had left this world behind for good.

But they are still here, making trouble. Their black rites go unnoticed until a village is slaughtered by some winged horror or a castle is besieged by colossal nightmares. When they want something from the normal people they so despise, these spawn summoners merely bid their astral minions take it. They care little for the lives of others. To them, we are as nothing.

boardgame.name: Tome of Adversaries
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Terran Empire Publishing presents the Tome of Adversaries volume one!

30 new and intriguing monsters and beasts for your 5th edition adventures and campaigns.

Each monster listing includes a detailed stat block, background information, and interesting tidbits of lore.

boardgame.name: 100 Low Fantasy Followers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everyone has a story, a quirk, or a fetish item... including bandits.

This product contains a list of 100 bandits. Each of them comes with a name, a one sentence description and loot.

boardgame.name: Kensai & Lightning
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A little over twelve years ago, a handful of disillusioned GEnS (genetically-enhanced subjects) formed a criminal alliance known as the Coalition. Initially, this group proclaimed itself dedicated to overthrowing autocratic regimes and eradicating the growing influence of mega-corporations. It didn’t take long, however, for their true focus to become apparent: making massive amounts of money, punishing their enemies, and getting revenge for any perceived wrongs or insults. Whatever their mission statement, the Coalition proved itself effective and dangerous enough to make the wanted lists of several global law enforcement agencies and super-powered groups. The Coalition engaged in a relatively brief but eventful career that (for now) ended in defeat at the hands of Strikeforce One with the aid of a dozen EaGLE Division (Espionage and Governmental Law Enforcement) agents. Three of the Coalition members died, eight went to prison (although several of them have escaped on more than one occasion), and one vanished and remains at large.

This PDF contains everything you need to know about Kensai & Lightning, in the Amazing Universe Campaign or any other superhero campaign.
boardgame.rpgseries: Official Handbook of the Amazing Universe

boardgame.name: Noxo
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

These man eaters are as big as a bull, cunning, quick and equipped with lashing tentacles, frontal stabbing legs and whatever armament the foremost torso wields. Worse, these genetically engineered battle beasts make separate mental or energy attacks from each of their three hideous heads, and if a hunt isn’t going its way, it will unleash a gaseous discharge of noxious, eye and throat burning tear gas — a feature which is the source of this monster’s name.

The noxo is our 21st Monday Mutant for The Mutant Epoch (TME) Tabletop RPG. This wasteland horror is dangerous at any distance, actively hunts dig teams, caravans and entire villages, and often isn’t alone. Besides moving in small packs, many ancient specimens of these enormous, unpredictable beasts knowingly play along with cults of primitives, especially skullocks and moaners, and serve as their impatient, ever hungry and demanding god. What foul deeds will the devotees of a noxo undertake? What will the tentacled, multi-headed ruin lord do to either expand its territory or eliminate the intrusions of human excavators into its wasteland realm?

The noxo PDF is an 8 page listing that includes a special selection table needed to a randomly assign a different mutation to each of the beast’s three heads. Other tables include the weaponry held by the frontal torso and a meaty 2d20 loot table which besides valuables, has a few adventure hooks laced into it as well as NPC captives in dire need of rescue. This freak isn’t something game masters would want to put in the path of 1st rank characters, unless they are clever, fast, or both. Grab your copy of the noxo today!

boardgame.name: Hero Realms
boardgame.description: App version of the board game Hero Realms.

boardgame.name: Ruins of Symbaroum Player's Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the Ruins of Symbaroum game line, the acclaimed setting of Symbaroum comes to the world’s most popular roleplaying game rules! This richly illustrated, 236-page Player’s Guide introduces setting specific rules and provides guidelines on how to create player characters for adventures in the world of Symbaroum using the 5th Edition OGL ruleset!
_____________________________________________

Ruins of Symbaroum invites you to join in the adventure! Explore the vast Forest of Davokar in the hunt for treasure, lost wisdom and fame. Visit the barbarian clans to trade or to plunder their treasuries. Establish a base of power among princes, guilds or rebellious refugees in the capital city of Yndaros. Or survive encounters with arch trolls, dark-minded blight beasts and undead warlords. But whatever you do, never ignore the warnings spoken by the wardens of the forest: tread carefully and do not disturb the ruins of old, for the darkness of Davokar is about to awaken…
____________________________________________

CONTENT

A player facing introduction to the lore, settlements and factions of the game setting.
Setting specific rules on travelling, rests, social challenges, and the blight of corruption.
Nine player character origins with custom backgrounds.
Five new character classes with a total of 32 new approaches (sub-classes).
New equipment in the form of weapons, armor, alchemical elixirs, mystical artifacts, and more.
Spell lists for the mystical traditions sorcerer, theurg, troll singer, witch and wizard, including 24 new spells.

boardgame.name: Ruins of Symbaroum Gamemaster's Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the Ruins of Symbaroum game line, the acclaimed setting of Symbaroum comes to the world’s most popular roleplaying game rules! This richly illustrated, 236-page Player’s Guide introduces setting specific rules and provides guidelines on how to create player characters for adventures in the world of Symbaroum using the 5th Edition OGL ruleset!
_____________________________________________

Time to prep and plan! Have your players uncover the secrets of Thistle Hold, Yndaros and Karvosti, or develop your own adventure sites in the Symbaroum setting. Send the player characters into the forest of Davokar on treasure hunts, holy missions or to establish an outpost, while facing pre-planned or randomly generated challenges. Determine what type of rewards to bestow on the adventurers – be it traditional treasure, mystical artifacts, new feats, pacts with creatures or factions, or even a domain of their own to govern. The Symbaroum setting can be the staging ground for many kinds of adventures, and this book helps you make the world your own!
____________________________________________

CONTENT

Extensive information on the capital city of Yndaros, the fortune hunter’s town of Thistle Hold, and Karvosti, the cliff of the High Chieftain and the Huldra.
Guidelines and tables for placing adventures in the Underworld, Yonderworld and Spirit World.
Advanced rules regarding expeditions into the forest of Davokar, to be used when designing or randomly creating thrilling treasure hunts, journeys of exploration and other kinds of wilderness adventures.
Informed instructions and guidelines regarding the design of game worlds, adventures, and epic campaigns.
A chapter on how to make in-game rewards more interesting and tailored to different player types, also including twenty-seven mystical artifacts, each with its own adventure setup.
A long list of optional rules, regarding advanced traps, troupe play, ceremonial magic, managing domains, pitched battles, pact making, social challenges, and more.
The one-shot adventure Blight Night, set at the edge of Davokar Forest, as an example of how adventure landscapes in Symbaroum can be built.

boardgame.name: Ruins of Symbaroum Bestiary
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the Ruins of Symbaroum game line, the acclaimed setting of Symbaroum comes to the world’s most popular roleplaying game rules! This richly illustrated, 236-page Player’s Guide introduces setting specific rules and provides guidelines on how to create player characters for adventures in the world of Symbaroum using the 5th Edition OGL ruleset!
_____________________________________________

Explorers beware! More than a hundred creatures, monsters and abominations are crammed together between these covers – some of them well known, others only mentioned in legends and fairy tales; some unstoppably hungry, others open to negotiations; some presented in detail, others with only short descriptions. Call them Bestiaals, Night Swarmers, Illgoblins, Nefarani or Skullbiters – the creatures of Symbaroum are all capable of turning your forest expedition into a terrifying nightmare!
____________________________________________

CONTENT

More than thirty fully described and beautifully illustrated creatures with the potential to be at the center of unique adventures and challenges in Symbaroum.
Close to 60 additional creatures, sorted into categories such as Abominations, Predators, Spiders and Undead, and presented with short descriptions and stat blocks.
A similar section introducing 60+ generic non-player characters, grouped in classes such as Champions of Prios, People of Davokar, Townsfolk, Elves and Trolls.
Approximately 200 features, traits, reactions, lair actions and more, to be used when you design unique monstrosities to challenge your players.
Guidelines and rules for terrain features, covering Cities and Towns, Farmlands, Forests, Swamps, and more.

boardgame.name: Comixxx Memories
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Memory game where you turn cards to find two matching cards in order to remove them and reveal one of the 15 uncensored images of naked women in a comic book art style.

boardgame.name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles - Core Book
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From the Kickstarter:

This role-playing game will enable you to play a whole range of famous and unknown characters from the comics, films, series, or your own imagination.

Whether you and your friends choose an atmosphere of action, investigation, adventure, or suspense, Gotham City will be waiting with its avenues, skyscrapers, subterranean tunnels, criminal world, secrets, magic, and incomparable ambience, which is the result of 80 years of creations since the Dark Knight first appeared.

User summary:

The roleplaying game is derived from, and intended fully to be compatible with, the board game Batman: Gotham City Chronicles and its expansions.
boardgame.rpg: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles - The Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles - Adventures Book
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From the Kickstarter:

Whether you and your friends choose an atmosphere of action, investigation, adventure, or suspense, Gotham City will be waiting with its avenues, skyscrapers, subterranean tunnels, criminal world, secrets, magic, and incomparable ambience, which is the result of 80 years of creations since the Dark Knight first appeared.

User summary:

The roleplaying game is derived from, and intended fully to be compatible with, the board game Batman: Gotham City Chronicles and its expansions.

boardgame.name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles - Gotham City Guide
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From the Kickstarter:
