The reclusive islanders have sent out a call for aid to stalwart adventurers, hoping to remove what they suspect to be the meddling of a dark and loathsome cult.

Pack your protective magics, for without them, an exploration of the volcano will test the mettle of the best! Only the fiercest of heroes may find out the truth about the Guardian of Ahtu.

boardgame.name: Doomed Dockyard Defense
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon for 4–5 characters of levels 3–4

It’ll take some quick sleuthing, silver tongues, and a proper plan to make the arrival of the naive company’s funds anything other than a Doomed Dockyard Defense.

Is your party up to the task?

boardgame.name: Deep Water
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon for 4–5 characters of levels 4–5

The secrets of spell-storing gem fabrication remain closely guarded by the deep gnomes, but the most important ingredient is immediately obvious: raw gemstones.

Recently, one such gnomish-held gem mine deep beneath the surface was overrun by monsters and the erstwhile owners are desperate to reclaim it.

The deep gnomes are offering a magic gem each to any adventures who can clear out the monsters, but the air is thick and hard to breathe, and even the remains of the fallen may hold dangers. Any would-be saviors or greedy mercenaries who don’t use their wits will find themselves in Deep Water!

boardgame.name: Angel's Share
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon for 4–6 characters of levels 1–2

Can the adventurers handle the intoxicating exploration of the distillery’s mysteries, or will their story and that of the distillery vanish in the lightless Underworld like the Angel’s Share?

boardgame.name: Golemancer's Gauntlet
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon for 3–5 characters of levels 10–12

It takes more than brawn to defeat Zarastra the Golemancer in her deadly complex and emerge victorious from the lethal defenses of the Golemancer’s Gauntlet!

boardgame.name: Chill in the Air
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon for 4–5 characters of levels 8–10

A fierce winter storm has torn down from the mountains and spilled across the swath of plains villages below, unleashing frigid, howling winds. The sheer volume of swirling snow is unusual for the region, but especially so for this time of year: spring.

It is not solely the drop in temperatures, but also the hushed whispers among the elders that send shivers down the spine of any who dare inquire, for they speak of Kemlek, immortal chosen of the winter wind, returned once more to the land of the living to bring winter unending.

If the immortal champion remains unopposed, undefeated, a Chill in the Air will remain but the first sign of a dire cold that consumes all it touches…

boardgame.name: Tenebrous Tales
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon for 4–6 characters of levels 6–8

A heavily guarded caravan, transporting gems and treasures belonging to a nearby duke, was found decimated at sunrise. The few survivors claim they were attacked by average highwaymen, but surely, no common robbers could have defeated the formidable defenses of the caravan?!

A mystery warranting the intervention of adventurers, but they might find more than they bargained for!

In a dark cavern, a black flame burns unopposed, and if it is not extinguished, the Tenebrous Trails of the machinations of its master will have far-reaching consequences…

boardgame.name: Toll of the Void
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon for 3–5 characters of levels 6–8

When the renowned mage Khalastan, went missing in search of forbidden knowledge within the ruined tower of Z’lar Kotek, tremors and magic surges have wracked the surrounding landscape.

His desperate apprentice, Cal Renther, has asked for assistance in entering the ruins and save his mentor, but what awaits the adventurers that respond to his call is no mere little dungeon exploration!

The otherworldly magics unleashed by Khalastan demand a price, and in order to emerge victorious, every hero must ask themself: Am I willing to pay the Toll of the Void?

boardgame.name: Nightmares at Thorn House
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon for 3–5 characters of levels 6–8

When the renowned mage Khalastan, went missing in search of forbidden knowledge within the ruined tower of Z’lar Kotek, tremors and magic surges have wracked the surrounding landscape.

His desperate apprentice, Cal Renther, has asked for assistance in entering the ruins and save his mentor, but what awaits the adventurers that respond to his call is no mere little dungeon exploration!

The otherworldly magics unleashed by Khalastan demand a price, and in order to emerge victorious, every hero must ask themself: Am I willing to pay the Toll of the Void?

boardgame.name: Cliffside Hoot
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon for 4–5 characters of level 13

In a secluded mountain valley life goes on as it has for centuries. Recently, however, the farmers’ idyllic existence has been threatened by a creature, which survivors describe as a fusion of owl and lion, that comes in the night to hunt down livestock.

But there is more to this strange predator than meets the eye: Among the ragged mountain peaks is an ancient monastery, nestled right in the cliffside, and it is here than the creature’s trail leads.

It seemed to be a simple monster extermination assignment, but it remains to be seen whether it’s the party or their enemy who’ll have a true Cliffside Hoot!
